# Django in relation to Di√°taxis - Logan

::: {.incremental .fade-right style="margin-top: -0.2em; font-size: 0.775em;"}

 - Django utilizes Tutorials/Learning-oriented documentation
 - Django utilizes How-To Guides/Goal-oriented documentation
 - Django utilizes References/Information-oriented documentation
 - Django separates documentation types.
 - Django documentation achieves Functional Quality under Diataxis standards(accurate, complete, useful, consistent)
 - Django documentation does not achieves Deep Quality under Diataxis Standards(Bad flow , anticipation of the user , not having a good feeling during the use of Django)
 - Django documentation somewhat writes with user goal in mind (installing and using Django)

# Strengths of `Django` documentation - Logan

::: {.incremental .fade-right style="margin-top: -0.2em; font-size: 0.775em;"}
 - Offers a wide varity of types of documention to use such as Tutorials,How-To-Guides,and
 References.
 - Seperates its documentation into different subsections for easier use.
 - It gives beginner and advanced documention for each subsection category.
 - Gives well-presented code examples for each document in the documention.
 - Has an FAQ to answer commonley asked questions.
 - Django gives lots of documention on every aspect of the framework
